page.title: 11Knolton Hall,Ellesmere CP
page.content: Knolton Hall is set in 106 acres of land.The land used to be farmed but is now let to other people.The River Dee and the Shell Brook form 2 of the boundaries and a third one is the B5069 road. This large house and its lodge were built in Tudor times and is distinguished by having 12 chimneys. The family who live there today only use about one third of the house.Many of the rooms which are not used include a dairy larder, a laundry room and a dead game room. Most of the rooms have high ceilings with plaster mouldings and wooden floors, mostly furnished with wooden antiques. Every room in the house has 4 or 5 windows which are very long and narrow. The doors to the rooms are of solid wood having large brass knobs. The many fireplaces are large and made of marble and cast-iron.
